context: New Haven (local /nuː ˈheɪvən/, noo-HAY-vən), in the U.S. state of <a0_0>Connecticut<a0_0/>, is the principal municipality in Greater New Haven, which had a total population of <a8_0>862,477<a8_0/> in 2010. It is located on New Haven Harbor on the northern shore of the <a1_0>Long Island Sound<a1_0/> in <a2_0><a7_0>New Haven County<a2_0/>,<a7_0/> Connecticut, which in turn comprises the outer limits of the <a4_0><a9_0>New York<a9_0/> metropolitan area<a4_0/>. It is the second-largest city in Connecticut (after <a6_0>Bridgeport<a6_0/>), with a population of <a3_0><a5_0>129,779<a5_0/><a3_0/> people as of the 2010 United States Census. According to a census of 1 July 2012, by the Census Bureau, the city had a population of 130,741.
